answers.answer: Hey Ava!Well, I would suggest visiting the ER, since the pain related to heart issues could radiate to the neck and jaw as well, in addition to the classically described left shoulder. Once heart issues have been ruled out, one may proceed to look at other possibilities such as respiratory tract infections, TMJ issues etc. You may like to consult a primary care physician for the same. After a cause id diagnosed, it can be managed accordingly.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: Hi, I have a history of diabetes, lower back pain, muscle spasms,cervical disc surgery, torn pyraforamis muscle in my left hip, plus several other health problems too numerous to mention.  My concern right now in intermittent severe pain in my lower jaw and neck radiating to my cheat with heaviness andsome difficulty getting a good deep breath.  I know that symptoms of a impending heart attack is different in women than in men, so what is the jaw-neck pain indicative of.  Should I see my physician or go to the ER?  Please respond at your earliest convenience.  Thanks,  Ava
title: I am a retired LPN
